thread.section_title: Liverpool star Roberto Firmino set to miss Paraguay game after missing Brazil training – Metro
thread.title: Liverpool star Roberto Firmino set to miss Paraguay game after missing Brazil training
thread.title_full: Liverpool star Roberto Firmino set to miss Paraguay game after missing Brazil training

author: Coral Barry
title: Liverpool star Roberto Firmino set to miss Paraguay game after missing Brazil training
text:
Roberto Firmino is on international duty with Brazil (Picture: Getty) Roberto Firmino is set to miss Brazil’s World Cup qualifier against Paraguay after missing training on Monday, according to reports in Brazil.
Marco Verratti reveals the club he would happily leave PSG for The Liverpool star played 89 minutes in Brazil’s 4-1 win over Uruguay on Friday, but will sit out their final game of the current round of international fixtures.
Firmino is believed to have missed training because of throat inflammation and not because of any serious injury.
Liverpool play Everton on Saturday and will want Firmino and Brazil team-mate Philippe Coutinho back in top shape ahead of the local derby.
Coutinho is set to play in the early hours of Wednesday morning against Paraguay before traveling back to Liverpool.
Liverpool play Everton on Saturday (Picture: Getty) More: Football Thierry Henry loves Kylian Mbappe but says he must do one more thing to be star 
Video: Chelsea youngster RUINS team-mates with CLASS goal in training 
Where’s it all gone wrong for the Netherlands national team? 
Firmino’s throat problem could be a blessing in disguise for Liverpool who will have two of their most influential stars flying 6,000 miles three days before facing Everton.
Liverpool will be desperate to do the league double over Everton and keep Manchester United and Arsenal at bay.
MORE: Liverpool believe transfer for Manchester United and Chelsea target James Rodriguez possible
